meanings.definition: To make sweet or sweeter in taste.
meanings.sent1: I will sweeten the tea with a little honey.
meanings.sent2: She used sugar to sweeten the bitter coffee.
meanings.sent3: Grandma always sweetens her famous apple pie with cinnamon.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children sweetens the air in the playground.
meanings.sent5: The warm sunlight seemed to sweeten the fresh strawberries even more.

meanings.definition: To make more pleasant or agreeable.
meanings.sent1: A kind gesture can sweeten someone's day.
meanings.sent2: The apology helped sweeten the tense situation.
meanings.sent3: His funny jokes never fail to sweeten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful music sweetened the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: A smile can sweeten even the toughest of conversations.

meanings.definition: To add sugar or another sweet substance to.
meanings.sent1: I always sweeten my oatmeal with a sprinkle of brown sugar.
meanings.sent2: She decided to sweeten the lemonade with some fresh strawberries.
meanings.sent3: The chef will sweeten the sauce with a touch of maple syrup.
meanings.sent4: The baker will sweeten the frosting with a hint of vanilla extract.
meanings.sent5: He likes to sweeten his pancakes with a drizzle of maple syrup.
